api_key.Description: (Required unless validate is false) Datadog API key. This can also be set via the DD_API_KEY environment variable.

api_url.Description: The API URL. This can also be set via the DD_HOST environment variable. Note that this URL must not end with the /api/ path. For example, https://api.datadoghq.com/ is a correct value, while https://api.datadoghq.com/api/ is not. And if you're working with "EU" version of Datadog, use https://api.datadoghq.eu/.

app_key.Description: (Required unless validate is false) Datadog APP key. This can also be set via the DD_APP_KEY environment variable.

http_client_retry_enabled.Description: Enables request retries on HTTP status codes 429 and 5xx.

http_client_retry_timeout.Description: The HTTP request retry timeout period.

validate.Description: Enables validation of the provided API and APP keys during provider initialization. Default is true. When false, api_key and app_key won't be checked.

key.Description: The value of the API Key.

name.Description: Name for API Key.

key.Description: The value of the Application Key.

name.Description: Name for Application Key.
Name of your API key.

application_key.Description: An application key with its associated metadata.

name.Description: Name of an application key.
Name for Child Organization after creation.

public_id.Description: The `public_id` of the organization you are operating within.

private_widget_share.Description: Whether or not the organization users can share widgets outside of Datadog.

saml_autocreate_access_role.Description: The access role of the user. Options are `st` (standard user), `adm` (admin user), or `ro` (read-only user). Allowed enum values: `st`, `adm` , `ro`, `ERROR`

active.Description: When true indicates this downtime is being actively applied

active_child_id.Description: The id corresponding to the downtime object definition of the active child for the original parent recurring downtime. This field will only exist on recurring downtimes.

disabled.Description: When true indicates this downtime is not being applied

end.Description: Optionally specify an end date when this downtime should expire

end_date.Description: String representing date and time to end the downtime in RFC3339 format.

message.Description: An optional message to provide when creating the downtime, can include notification handles

monitor_id.Description: When specified, this downtime will only apply to this monitor

monitor_tags.Description: A list of monitor tags (up to 32) to base the scheduled downtime on. Only monitors that have all selected tags are silenced

recurrence.Description: Optional recurring schedule for this downtime

period.Description: How often to repeat as an integer. For example to repeat every 3 days, select a `type` of `days` and a `period` of `3`.

rrule.Description: The RRULE standard for defining recurring events. For example, to have a recurring event on the first day of each month, use `FREQ=MONTHLY;INTERVAL=1`. Most common rrule options from the iCalendar Spec are supported. Attributes specifying the duration in RRULE are not supported (for example, `DTSTART`, `DTEND`, `DURATION`).

type.Description: One of `days`, `weeks`, `months`, or `years`

until_date.Description: The date at which the recurrence should end as a POSIX timestamp. `until_occurrences` and `until_date` are mutually exclusive.

until_occurrences.Description: How many times the downtime will be rescheduled. `until_occurrences` and `until_date` are mutually exclusive.

week_days.Description: A list of week days to repeat on. Choose from: `Mon`, `Tue`, `Wed`, `Thu`, `Fri`, `Sat` or `Sun`. Only applicable when `type` is `weeks`. First letter must be capitalized.

scope.Description: specify the group scope to which this downtime applies. For everything use '*'

start.Description: Specify when this downtime should start

start_date.Description: String representing date and time to start the downtime in RFC3339 format.

timezone.Description: The timezone for the downtime, default UTC

access_key_id.Description: Your AWS access key ID. Only required if your AWS account is a GovCloud or China account.

account_id.Description: Your AWS Account ID without dashes.

account_specific_namespace_rules.Description: Enables or disables metric collection for specific AWS namespaces for this AWS account only. A list of namespaces can be found at the [available namespace rules API endpoint](https://docs.datadoghq.com/api/v1/aws-integration/#list-namespace-rules).

excluded_regions.Description: An array of AWS regions to exclude from metrics collection.

external_id.Description: AWS External ID. **NOTE** This provider will not be able to detect changes made to the `external_id` field from outside Terraform.

filter_tags.Description: Array of EC2 tags (in the form `key:value`) defines a filter that Datadog uses when collecting metrics from EC2. Wildcards, such as `?` (for single characters) and `*` (for multiple characters) can also be used. Only hosts that match one of the defined tags will be imported into Datadog. The rest will be ignored. Host matching a given tag can also be excluded by adding `!` before the tag. e.x. `env:production,instance-type:c1.*,!region:us-east-1`.

host_tags.Description: Array of tags (in the form `key:value`) to add to all hosts and metrics reporting through this integration.

secret_access_key.Description: Your AWS secret access key. Only required if your AWS account is a GovCloud or China account.

account_id.Description: Your AWS Account ID without dashes. If your account is a GovCloud or China account, specify the `access_key_id` here.

lambda_arn.Description: The ARN of the Datadog forwarder Lambda.

account_id.Description: Your AWS Account ID without dashes. If your account is a GovCloud or China account, specify the `access_key_id` here.

services.Description: A list of services to collect logs from. See the [api docs](https://docs.datadoghq.com/api/v1/aws-logs-integration/#get-list-of-aws-log-ready-services) for more details on which services are supported.

account_id.Description: Your AWS Account ID without dashes. If your account is a GovCloud or China account, specify the `access_key_id` here.

namespace.Description: The namespace associated with the tag filter entry.

automute.Description: Silence monitors for expected Azure VM shutdowns.

client_secret.Description: (Required for Initial Creation) Your Azure web application secret key.

host_filters.Description: String of host tag(s) (in the form `key:value,key:value`) defines a filter that Datadog will use when collecting metrics from Azure. Limit the Azure instances that are pulled into Datadog by using tags. Only hosts that match one of the defined tags are imported into Datadog. e.x. `env:production,deploymentgroup:red`

automute.Description: Silence monitors for expected GCE instance shutdowns.

client_email.Description: Your email found in your JSON service account key.

client_id.Description: Your ID found in your JSON service account key.

host_filters.Description: Limit the GCE instances that are pulled into Datadog by using tags. Only hosts that match one of the defined tags are imported into Datadog.

private_key.Description: Your private key name found in your JSON service account key.

private_key_id.Description: Your private key ID found in your JSON service account key.

project_id.Description: Your Google Cloud project ID found in your JSON service account key.

subdomain.Description: Your PagerDuty accounts personalized subdomain name.

service_key.Description: Your Service name associated service key in PagerDuty. Note: Since the Datadog API never returns service keys, it is impossible to detect [drifts](https://www.hashicorp.com/blog/detecting-and-managing-drift-with-terraform). The best way to solve a drift is to manually mark the Service Object resource with [terraform taint](https://www.terraform.io/docs/commands/taint.html) to have it destroyed and recreated.

display.Description: Configuration options for what is shown in an alert event message.

message.Description: Show the main body of the alert event.

notified.Description: Show the list of @-handles in the alert event.

snapshot.Description: Show the alert event's snapshot image.

tags.Description: Show the scopes on which the monitor alerted.

daily_limit.Description: The number of log events you can send in this index per day before you are rate-limited.

disable_daily_limit.Description: If true, sets the daily_limit value to null and the index is not limited on a daily basis (any specified daily_limit value in the request is ignored). If false or omitted, the index's current daily_limit is maintained.

query.Description: Only logs matching the filter criteria and the query of the parent index will be considered for this exclusion filter.

sample_rate.Description: The fraction of logs excluded by the exclusion filter, when active.

is_enabled.Description: A boolean stating if the exclusion is active or not.

name.Description: The name of the exclusion filter.

query.Description: Logs filter criteria. Only logs matching this filter criteria are considered for this index.

name.Description: The name of the index.

retention_days.Description: The number of days before logs are deleted from this index.

indexes.Description: The index resource list. Logs are tested against the query filter of each index one by one following the order of the list.

name.Description: The unique name of the index order resource.

is_enabled.Description: Boolean value to enable your pipeline.

compute.Description: The compute rule to compute the log-based metric. This field can't be updated after creation.

aggregation_type.Description: The type of aggregation to use. This field can't be updated after creation.

path.Description: The path to the value the log-based metric will aggregate on (only used if the aggregation type is a "distribution"). This field can't be updated after creation.

filter.Description: The log-based metric filter. Logs matching this filter will be aggregated in this metric.

query.Description: The search query - following the log search syntax.

group_by.Description: The rules for the group by.

path.Description: The path to the value the log-based metric will be aggregated over.

tag_name.Description: Name of the tag that gets created.

name.Description: The name of the log-based metric. This field can't be updated after creation.

The name attribute in the resource `datadog_logs_pipeline_order` needs to be unique. It's recommended to use the same value as the resource name. No related field is available in [Logs Pipeline API](https://docs.datadoghq.com/api/v1/logs-pipelines/#get-pipeline-order).

pipelines.Description: The pipeline IDs list. The order of pipeline IDs in this attribute defines the overall pipeline order for logs.

per_unit.Description: Per unit of the metric such as `second` in `bytes per second`.

short_name.Description: A short name of the metric.

statsd_interval.Description: If applicable, statsd flush interval in seconds for the metric.

type.Description: Type of the metric.

unit.Description: Primary unit of the metric such as `byte` or `operation`.

aggregations.Description: A list of queryable aggregation combinations for a count, rate, or gauge metric. By default, count and rate metrics require the (time: sum, space: sum) aggregation and gauge metrics require the (time: avg, space: avg) aggregation. Can only be applied to metrics that have a `metric_type` of count, rate, or gauge.

space.Description: A space aggregation for use in query.

time.Description: A time aggregation for use in query.

include_percentiles.Description: Toggle to include/exclude percentiles for a distribution metric. Defaults to false. Can only be applied to metrics that have a `metric_type` of distribution.

metric_name.Description: The metric name for this resource.

metric_type.Description: The metric's type. This field can't be updated after creation.

tags.Description: A list of tag keys that will be queryable for your metric.

enable_logs_sample.Description: A boolean indicating whether or not to include a list of log values which triggered the alert. This is only used by log monitors. Defaults to `false`.

escalation_message.Description: A message to include with a re-notification. Supports the `@username` notification allowed elsewhere.

evaluation_delay.Description:
(Only applies to metric alert) Time (in seconds) to delay evaluation, as a non-negative integer.

For example, if the value is set to `300` (5min), the `timeframe` is set to `last_5m` and the time is 7:00, the monitor will evaluate data from 6:50 to 6:55. This is useful for AWS CloudWatch and other backfilled metrics to ensure the monitor will always have data during evaluation.

force_delete.Description: A boolean indicating whether this monitor can be deleted even if its referenced by other resources (e.g. SLO, composite monitor).

groupby_simple_monitor.Description: Whether or not to trigger one alert if any source breaches a threshold. This is only used by log monitors. Defaults to `false`.

include_tags.Description: A boolean indicating whether notifications from this monitor automatically insert its triggering tags into the title. Defaults to `true`.

locked.Description: A boolean indicating whether changes to this monitor should be restricted to the creator or admins. Defaults to `false`.

message.Description:
A message to include with notifications for this monitor.

Email notifications can be sent to specific users by using the same `@username` notation as events.

monitor_threshold_windows.Description: A mapping containing `recovery_window` and `trigger_window` values, e.g. `last_15m` . Can only be used for, and are required for, anomaly monitors.

recovery_window.Description: Describes how long an anomalous metric must be normal before the alert recovers.

trigger_window.Description: Describes how long a metric must be anomalous before an alert triggers.

critical.Description: The monitor `CRITICAL` threshold. Must be a number.

critical_recovery.Description: The monitor `CRITICAL` recovery threshold. Must be a number.

ok.Description: The monitor `OK` threshold. Must be a number.

unknown.Description: The monitor `UNKNOWN` threshold. Must be a number.

warning.Description: The monitor `WARNING` threshold. Must be a number.

warning_recovery.Description: The monitor `WARNING` recovery threshold. Must be a number.

name.Description: Name of Datadog monitor.

new_group_delay.Description:
The time (in seconds) to skip evaluations for new groups.

`new_group_delay` overrides `new_host_delay` if it is set to a nonzero value.

new_host_delay.Description: **Deprecated**. See `new_group_delay`. Time (in seconds) to allow a host to boot and applications to fully start before starting the evaluation of monitor results. Should be a non-negative integer. This value is ignored for simple monitors and monitors not grouped by host. Defaults to `300`. The only case when this should be used is to override the default and set `new_host_delay` to zero for monitors grouped by host.
new_host_delay.Deprecated: Use `new_group_delay` except when setting `new_host_delay` to zero.

no_data_timeframe.Description:
The number of minutes before a monitor will notify when data stops reporting. Provider defaults to 10 minutes.

We recommend at least 2x the monitor timeframe for metric alerts or 2 minutes for service checks.

notify_audit.Description: A boolean indicating whether tagged users will be notified on changes to this monitor. Defaults to `false`.

notify_no_data.Description: A boolean indicating whether this monitor will notify when data stops reporting. Defaults to `false`.

priority.Description: Integer from 1 (high) to 5 (low) indicating alert severity.

query.Description:
The monitor query to notify on. Note this is not the same query you see in the UI and the syntax is different depending on the monitor type, please see the [API Reference](https://docs.datadoghq.com/api/v1/monitors/#create-a-monitor) for details. `terraform plan` will validate query contents unless `validate` is set to `false`.

**Note:** APM latency data is now available as Distribution Metrics. Existing monitors have been migrated automatically but all terraformed monitors can still use the existing metrics. We strongly recommend updating monitor definitions to query the new metrics. To learn more, or to see examples of how to update your terraform definitions to utilize the new distribution metrics, see the [detailed doc](https://docs.datadoghq.com/tracing/guide/ddsketch_trace_metrics/).

renotify_interval.Description: The number of minutes after the last notification before a monitor will re-notify on the current status. It will only re-notify if it's not resolved.

renotify_occurrences.Description: The number of re-notification messages that should be sent on the current status.

renotify_statuses.Description: The types of statuses for which re-notification messages should be sent.

require_full_window.Description:
A boolean indicating whether this monitor needs a full window of data before it's evaluated.

We highly recommend you set this to `false` for sparse metrics, otherwise some evaluations will be skipped. Default: `true` for `on average`, `at all times` and `in total` aggregation. `false` otherwise.

tags.Description: A list of tags to associate with your monitor. This can help you categorize and filter monitors in the manage monitors page of the UI. Note: it's not currently possible to filter by these tags when querying via the API

timeout_h.Description: The number of hours of the monitor not reporting data before it will automatically resolve from a triggered state.

type.Description: The type of the monitor. The mapping from these types to the types found in the Datadog Web UI can be found in the Datadog API [documentation page](https://docs.datadoghq.com/api/v1/monitors/#create-a-monitor). Note: The monitor type cannot be changed after a monitor is created.

validate.Description: If set to `false`, skip the validation call done during plan.

monitor.Description: The JSON formatted definition of the monitor.

name.Description: Name for Organization.

public_id.Description: The `public_id` of the organization you are operating within.

private_widget_share.Description: Whether or not the organization users can share widgets outside of Datadog.

enabled.Description: Whether or not SAML is enabled for this organization.

saml_autocreate_access_role.Description: The access role of the user. Options are `st` (standard user), `adm` (admin user), or `ro` (read-only user). Allowed enum values: `st`, `adm` , `ro`, `ERROR`

saml_autocreate_users_domains.Description: List of domains where the SAML automated user creation is enabled.

domains.Description: List of domains where the SAML automated user creation is enabled.

enabled.Description: Whether or not the automated user creation based on SAML domain is enabled.

saml_can_be_enabled.Description: Whether or not SAML can be enabled for this organization.

saml_idp_endpoint.Description: Identity provider endpoint for SAML authentication.

saml_idp_initiated_login.Description: Whether or not a SAML identity provider metadata file was provided to the Datadog organization.

enabled.Description: Whether or not a SAML identity provider metadata file was provided to the Datadog organization.

saml_idp_metadata_uploaded.Description: Whether or not a SAML identity provider metadata file was provided to the Datadog organization.

saml_strict_mode.Description: Whether or not the SAML strict mode is enabled. If true, all users must log in with SAML.

enabled.Description: Whether or not the SAML strict mode is enabled. If true, all users must log in with SAML.

name.Description: Name of the role.

permission.Description: Set of objects containing the permission ID and the name of the permissions granted to this role.

id.Description: ID of the permission to assign.

name.Description: Name of the permission.

user_count.Description: Number of users that have this role.

case.Description: Cases of the rule, this is used to update notifications.

notifications.Description: Notification targets for each rule case.

status.Description: Status of the rule case to match.

filter.Description: Additional queries to filter matched events before they are processed.

action.Description: The type of filtering action. Allowed enum values: require, suppress

query.Description: Query for selecting logs to apply the filtering action.

exclusion_filter.Description: Exclusion filters to exclude some logs from the security filter.

name.Description: Exclusion filter name.

query.Description: Exclusion filter query. Logs that match this query are excluded from the security filter.

is_enabled.Description: Whether the security filter is enabled.

name.Description: The name of the security filter.

query.Description: The query of the security filter.

version.Description: The version of the security filter.

condition.Description: A rule case contains logical operations (`>`,`>=`, `&&`, `||`) to determine if a signal should be generated based on the event counts in the previously defined queries.

name.Description: Name of the case.

notifications.Description: Notification targets for each rule case.

filter.Description: Additional queries to filter matched events before they are processed.

query.Description: Query for selecting logs to apply the filtering action.

has_extended_title.Description: Whether the notifications include the triggering group-by values in their title.

name.Description: The name of the rule.

evaluation_window.Description: A time window is specified to match when at least one of the cases matches true. This is a sliding window and evaluates in real time.

keep_alive.Description: Once a signal is generated, the signal will remain open if a case is matched at least once within this keep alive window.

max_signal_duration.Description: A signal will close regardless of the query being matched once the time exceeds the maximum duration. This time is calculated from the first seen timestamp.

forget_after.Description: The duration in days after which a learned value is forgotten.

learning_duration.Description: The duration in days during which values are learned, and after which signals will be generated for values that weren't learned. If set to 0, a signal will be generated for all new values after the first value is learned.

query.Description: Queries for selecting logs which are part of the rule.

agent_rule.Deprecated: `agent_rule` has been deprecated in favor of new Agent Rule resource.

distinct_fields.Description: Field for which the cardinality is measured. Sent as an array.

metric.Description: The target field to aggregate over when using the sum or max aggregations.

name.Description: Name of the query.

type.Description: The rule type.

description.Description: A description of this service level objective.

force_delete.Description: A boolean indicating whether this monitor can be deleted even if its referenced by other resources (e.g. dashboards).

groups.Description: A static set of groups to filter monitor-based SLOs

monitor_ids.Description: A static set of monitor IDs to use as part of the SLO

name.Description: Name of Datadog service level objective

query.Description: The metric query of good / total events

numerator.Description: The sum of all the `good` events.

tags.Description: A list of tags to associate with your service level objective. This can help you categorize and filter service level objectives in the service level objectives page of the UI. Note: it's not currently possible to filter by these tags when querying via the API

thresholds.Description: A list of thresholds and targets that define the service level objectives from the provided SLIs.

target_display.Description: A string representation of the target that indicates its precision. It uses trailing zeros to show significant decimal places (e.g. `98.00`).

timeframe.Description: The time frame for the objective. The mapping from these types to the types found in the Datadog Web UI can be found in the Datadog API documentation page.

warning.Description: The objective's warning value in `[0,100]`. This must be greater than the target value.

warning_display.Description: A string representation of the warning target (see the description of the target_display field for details).

type.Description: The type of the service level objective. The mapping from these types to the types found in the Datadog Web UI can be found in the Datadog API [documentation page](https://docs.datadoghq.com/api/v1/service-level-objectives/#create-a-slo-object).

validate.Description: Whether or not to validate the SLO.

category.Description: Category the SLO correction belongs to.

description.Description: Description of the correction being made.

duration.Description: Length of time in seconds for a specified `rrule` recurring SLO correction (required if specifying `rrule`)

end.Description: Ending time of the correction in epoch seconds. Required for one time corrections, but optional if `rrule` is specified

rrule.Description: Recurrence rules as defined in the iCalendar RFC 5545. Supported rules for SLO corrections are `FREQ`, `INTERVAL`, `COUNT` and `UNTIL`.

slo_id.Description: ID of the SLO that this correction will be applied to.

start.Description: Starting time of the correction in epoch seconds.

timezone.Description: The timezone to display in the UI for the correction times (defaults to "UTC")

name.Description: Synthetics global variable name.

parse_test_id.Description: Id of the Synthetics test to use for a variable from test.

parse_test_options.Description: ID of the Synthetics test to use a source of the global variable value.

field.Description: Required when type = `http_header`. Defines the header to use to extract the value

type.Description: Type of parser to extract the value.

value.Description: Value for the parser to use, required for type `json_path` or `regex`.

type.Description: Defines the source to use to extract the value.

restricted_roles.Description: A list of role identifiers to associate with the Synthetics global variable.

secure.Description: If set to true, the value of the global variable is hidden. Defaults to `false`.

tags.Description: A list of tags to associate with your synthetics global variable.

value.Description: The value of the global variable.

config.Description: Configuration skeleton for the private location. See installation instructions of the private location on how to use this configuration.

name.Description: Synthetics private location name.

tags.Description: A list of tags to associate with your synthetics private location.

allow_failure.Description: Determines whether or not to continue with test if this step fails.

assertion.Description: Assertions used for the test. Multiple `assertion` blocks are allowed with the structure below.

operator.Description: Assertion operator. **Note** Only some combinations of `type` and `operator` are valid (please refer to [Datadog documentation](https://docs.datadoghq.com/api/latest/synthetics/#create-a-test)).

property.Description: If assertion type is `header`, this is the header name.

target.Description: Expected value. Depends on the assertion type, refer to [Datadog documentation](https://docs.datadoghq.com/api/latest/synthetics/#create-a-test) for details.

targetjsonpath.Description: Expected structure if `operator` is `validatesJSONPath`. Exactly one nested block is allowed with the structure below.

operator.Description: The specific operator to use on the path.

type.Description: Type of assertion. **Note** Only some combinations of `type` and `operator` are valid (please refer to [Datadog documentation](https://docs.datadoghq.com/api/latest/synthetics/#create-a-test)).

extracted_value.Description: Values to parse and save as variables from the response.

field.Description: When type is `http_header`, name of the header to use to extract the value.

type.Description: Type of parser for a Synthetics global variable from a synthetics test.

value.Description: Regex or JSON path used for the parser. Not used with type `raw`.

type.Description: Property of the Synthetics Test Response to use for the variable.

is_critical.Description: Determines whether or not to consider the entire test as failed if this step fails. Can be used only if `allow_failure` is `true`.

name.Description: The name of the step.

request_basicauth.Description: The HTTP basic authentication credentials. Exactly one nested block is allowed with the structure below.

request_client_certificate.Description: Client certificate to use when performing the test request. Exactly one nested block is allowed with the structure below.

request_definition.Description: The request for the api step.

allow_insecure.Description: Allows loading insecure content for an HTTP test.

dns_server.Description: DNS server to use for DNS tests (`subtype = "dns"`).

dns_server_port.Description: DNS server port to use for DNS tests.

follow_redirects.Description: Determines whether or not the API HTTP test should follow redirects.

host.Description: Host name to perform the test with.

message.Description: For UDP and websocket tests, message to send with the request.

no_saving_response_body.Description: Determines whether or not to save the response body.

number_of_packets.Description: Number of pings to use per test for ICMP tests (`subtype = "icmp"`) between 0 and 10.

port.Description: Port to use when performing the test.

servername.Description: For SSL tests, it specifies on which server you want to initiate the TLS handshake, allowing the server to present one of multiple possible certificates on the same IP address and TCP port number.

should_track_hops.Description: This will turn on a traceroute probe to discover all gateways along the path to the host destination. For ICMP tests (`subtype = "icmp"`).

timeout.Description: Timeout in seconds for the test. Defaults to `60`.

url.Description: The URL to send the request to.

request_query.Description: Query arguments name and value map.

count.Description: Number of retries needed to consider a location as failed before sending a notification alert.

interval.Description: Interval between a failed test and the next retry in milliseconds.

subtype.Description: The subtype of the Synthetic multistep API test step.

assertion.Description: Assertions used for the test. Multiple `assertion` blocks are allowed with the structure below.

operator.Description: Assertion operator. **Note** Only some combinations of `type` and `operator` are valid (please refer to [Datadog documentation](https://docs.datadoghq.com/api/latest/synthetics/#create-a-test)).

property.Description: If assertion type is `header`, this is the header name.

target.Description: Expected value. Depends on the assertion type, refer to [Datadog documentation](https://docs.datadoghq.com/api/latest/synthetics/#create-a-test) for details.

targetjsonpath.Description: Expected structure if `operator` is `validatesJSONPath`. Exactly one nested block is allowed with the structure below.

operator.Description: The specific operator to use on the path.

type.Description: Type of assertion. **Note** Only some combinations of `type` and `operator` are valid (please refer to [Datadog documentation](https://docs.datadoghq.com/api/latest/synthetics/#create-a-test)).

allow_failure.Description: Determines if the step should be allowed to fail.

force_element_update.Description: Force update of the "element" parameter for the step

name.Description: Name of the step.

attribute.Description: Name of the attribute to use for an "assert attribute" step.

check.Description: Check type to use for an assertion step.

click_type.Description: Type of click to use for a "click" step.

code.Description: Javascript code to use for the step.

delay.Description: Delay between each key stroke for a "type test" step.

element.Description: Element to use for the step, json encoded string.

email.Description: Details of the email for an "assert email" step.

files.Description: Details of the files for an "upload files" step, json encoded string.

modifiers.Description: Modifier to use for a "press key" step.

playing_tab_id.Description: ID of the tab to play the subtest.

request.Description: Request for an API step.

subtest_public_id.Description: ID of the Synthetics test to use as subtest.

variable.Description: Details of the variable to extract.

name.Description: Name of the extracted variable.

timeout.Description: Used to override the default timeout of a step.

type.Description: Type of the step.

browser_variable.Description: Variables used for a browser test steps. Multiple `variable` blocks are allowed with the structure below.

id.Description: ID of the global variable to use. This is actually only used (and required) in the case of using a variable of type `global`.

name.Description: Name of the variable.

type.Description: Type of browser test variable.

config_variable.Description: Variables used for the test configuration. Multiple `config_variable` blocks are allowed with the structure below.

id.Description: When type = `global`, ID of the global variable to use.

name.Description: Name of the variable.

type.Description: Type of test configuration variable.

device_ids.Description: Required if `type = "browser"`. Array with the different device IDs used to run the test.

locations.Description: Array of locations used to run the test. Refer to [Datadog documentation](https://docs.datadoghq.com/synthetics/api_test/#request) for available locations (e.g. `aws:eu-central-1`).

message.Description: A message to include with notifications for this synthetics test. Email notifications can be sent to specific users by using the same `@username` notation as events.

monitor_id.Description: ID of the monitor associated with the Datadog synthetics test.

name.Description: Name of Datadog synthetics test.

accept_self_signed.Description: For SSL test, whether or not the test should allow self signed certificates.

allow_insecure.Description: Allows loading insecure content for an HTTP test.

follow_redirects.Description: Determines whether or not the API HTTP test should follow redirects.

min_failure_duration.Description: Minimum amount of time in failure required to trigger an alert. Default is `0`.

min_location_failed.Description: Minimum number of locations in failure required to trigger an alert. Default is `1`.

monitor_name.Description: The monitor name is used for the alert title as well as for all monitor dashboard widgets and SLOs.

no_screenshot.Description: Prevents saving screenshots of the steps.

count.Description: Number of retries needed to consider a location as failed before sending a notification alert.

interval.Description: Interval between a failed test and the next retry in milliseconds.

tick_every.Description: How often the test should run (in seconds).

request_basicauth.Description: The HTTP basic authentication credentials. Exactly one nested block is allowed with the structure below.

request_client_certificate.Description: Client certificate to use when performing the test request. Exactly one nested block is allowed with the structure below.

request_definition.Description: Required if `type = "api"`. The synthetics test request.

dns_server.Description: DNS server to use for DNS tests (`subtype = "dns"`).

dns_server_port.Description: DNS server port to use for DNS tests.

host.Description: Host name to perform the test with.

message.Description: For UDP and websocket tests, message to send with the request.

no_saving_response_body.Description: Determines whether or not to save the response body.

number_of_packets.Description: Number of pings to use per test for ICMP tests (`subtype = "icmp"`) between 0 and 10.

port.Description: Port to use when performing the test.

servername.Description: For SSL tests, it specifies on which server you want to initiate the TLS handshake, allowing the server to present one of multiple possible certificates on the same IP address and TCP port number.

should_track_hops.Description: This will turn on a traceroute probe to discover all gateways along the path to the host destination. For ICMP tests (`subtype = "icmp"`).

timeout.Description: Timeout in seconds for the test. Defaults to `60`.

url.Description: The URL to send the request to.

request_query.Description: Query arguments name and value map.

set_cookie.Description: Cookies to be used for a browser test request, using the [Set-Cookie](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/Set-Cookie) syntax.

status.Description: Define whether you want to start (`live`) or pause (`paused`) a Synthetic test.

subtype.Description: The subtype of the Synthetic API test. Defaults to `http`.

tags.Description: A list of tags to associate with your synthetics test. This can help you categorize and filter tests in the manage synthetics page of the UI. Default is an empty list (`[]`).

type.Description: Synthetics test type.

name.Description: Name for user.

roles.Description: A list a role IDs to assign to the user.

send_user_invitation.Description: Whether an invitation email should be sent when the user is created.

user_invitation_id.Description: The ID of the user invitation that was sent when creating the user.

verified.Description: Returns `true` if the user is verified.

custom_headers.Description: The headers attached to the webhook.

name.Description: The name of the webhook. It corresponds with `<WEBHOOK_NAME>`.

is_secret.Description: Whether the custom variable is secret or not.

name.Description: The name of the variable. It corresponds with `<CUSTOM_VARIABLE_NAME>`.

value.Description: The value of the custom variable.

key.Description: The value of the API Key.

name.Description: Name for API Key.

key.Description: The value of the Application Key.

name.Description: Name for Application Key.
The dashboard name to search for. Must only match one dashboard.

url.Description: The URL to a specific dashboard.

name.Description: A dashboard list name to limit the search.

agents_ipv4.Description: An Array of IPv4 addresses in CIDR format specifying the A records for the Agent endpoint.

agents_ipv6.Description: An Array of IPv6 addresses in CIDR format specifying the A records for the Agent endpoint.

api_ipv4.Description: An Array of IPv4 addresses in CIDR format specifying the A records for the API endpoint.

api_ipv6.Description: An Array of IPv6 addresses in CIDR format specifying the A records for the API endpoint.

apm_ipv4.Description: An Array of IPv4 addresses in CIDR format specifying the A records for the APM endpoint.

apm_ipv6.Description: An Array of IPv6 addresses in CIDR format specifying the A records for the APM endpoint.

logs_ipv4.Description: An Array of IPv4 addresses in CIDR format specifying the A records for the Logs endpoint.

logs_ipv6.Description: An Array of IPv6 addresses in CIDR format specifying the A records for the Logs endpoint.

process_ipv4.Description: An Array of IPv4 addresses in CIDR format specifying the A records for the Process endpoint.

process_ipv6.Description: An Array of IPv6 addresses in CIDR format specifying the A records for the Process endpoint.

synthetics_ipv4.Description: An Array of IPv4 addresses in CIDR format specifying the A records for the Synthetics endpoint.

synthetics_ipv4_by_location.Description: A map of IPv4 prefixes (string of concatenated IPs, delimited by ',') by location.

synthetics_ipv6.Description: An Array of IPv6 addresses in CIDR format specifying the A records for the Synthetics endpoint.

synthetics_ipv6_by_location.Description: A map of IPv6 prefixes (string of concatenated IPs, delimited by ',') by location.

webhooks_ipv4.Description: An Array of IPv4 addresses in CIDR format specifying the A records for the Webhooks endpoint.

webhooks_ipv6.Description: An Array of IPv6 addresses in CIDR format specifying the A records for the Webhooks endpoint.

index_names.Description: Array of strings identifying by their name(s) the index(es) of your organization. Logs are tested against the query filter of each index one by one, following the order of the array. Logs are eventually stored in the first matching index.

enable_logs_sample.Description: Whether or not a list of log values which triggered the alert is included. This is only used by log monitors.

escalation_message.Description: Message included with a re-notification for this monitor.

evaluation_delay.Description: Time (in seconds) for which evaluation is delayed. This is only used by metric monitors.

groupby_simple_monitor.Description: Whether or not to trigger one alert if any source breaches a threshold.

include_tags.Description: Whether or not notifications from the monitor automatically inserts its triggering tags into the title.

locked.Description: Whether or not changes to the monitor are restricted to the creator or admins.

message.Description: Message included with notifications for this monitor

monitor_tags_filter.Description: A list of monitor tags to limit the search. This filters on the tags set on the monitor itself.

monitor_threshold_windows.Description: Mapping containing `recovery_window` and `trigger_window` values, e.g. `last_15m`. This is only used by anomaly monitors.

name.Description: Name of the monitor

name_filter.Description: A monitor name to limit the search.

new_group_delay.Description: Time (in seconds) to skip evaluations for new groups.

new_host_delay.Description: Time (in seconds) allowing a host to boot and applications to fully start before starting the evaluation of monitor results.

no_data_timeframe.Description: The number of minutes before the monitor notifies when data stops reporting.

notify_audit.Description: Whether or not tagged users are notified on changes to the monitor.

notify_no_data.Description: Whether or not this monitor notifies when data stops reporting.

renotify_interval.Description: The number of minutes after the last notification before the monitor re-notifies on the current status.

renotify_occurrences.Description: The number of re-notification messages that should be sent on the current status.

renotify_statuses.Description: The types of statuses for which re-notification messages should be sent.

require_full_window.Description: Whether or not the monitor needs a full window of data before it is evaluated.

tags.Description: List of tags associated with the monitor.

tags_filter.Description: A list of tags to limit the search. This filters on the monitor scope.

timeout_h.Description: Number of hours of the monitor not reporting data before it automatically resolves from a triggered state.

type.Description: Type of the monitor.

monitor_tags_filter.Description: A list of monitor tags to limit the search. This filters on the tags set on the monitor itself.

name.Description: Name of the monitor

type.Description: Type of the monitor.

name_filter.Description: A monitor name to limit the search.

tags_filter.Description: A list of tags to limit the search. This filters on the monitor scope.

permissions.Description: Map of permissions names to their corresponding ID.

filter.Description: A string on which to filter the roles.

name.Description: Name of the role.

user_count.Description: Number of users assigned to this role.

filter.Description: Filter all roles by the given string.

name.Description: Name of the Datadog role

user_count.Description: Number of users that have this role.

exclusion_filter.Description: Exclusion filters to exclude some logs from the security filter.

name.Description: Exclusion filter name.

query.Description: Exclusion filter query. Logs that match this query are excluded from the security filter.

is_enabled.Description: Whether the security filter is enabled.

name.Description: The name of the security filter.

query.Description: The query of the security filter.

version.Description: The version of the security filter.

default_only_filter.Description: Limit the search to default rules

name_filter.Description: A rule name to limit the search

rule_ids.Description: List of IDs of the matched rules.

condition.Description: A rule case contains logical operations (`>`,`>=`, `&&`, `||`) to determine if a signal should be generated based on the event counts in the previously defined queries.

name.Description: Name of the case.

notifications.Description: Notification targets for each rule case.

filter.Description: Additional queries to filter matched events before they are processed.

query.Description: Query for selecting logs to apply the filtering action.

has_extended_title.Description: Whether the notifications include the triggering group-by values in their title.

name.Description: The name of the rule.

evaluation_window.Description: A time window is specified to match when at least one of the cases matches true. This is a sliding window and evaluates in real time.

keep_alive.Description: Once a signal is generated, the signal will remain open if a case is matched at least once within this keep alive window.

max_signal_duration.Description: A signal will close regardless of the query being matched once the time exceeds the maximum duration. This time is calculated from the first seen timestamp.

forget_after.Description: The duration in days after which a learned value is forgotten.

learning_duration.Description: The duration in days during which values are learned, and after which signals will be generated for values that weren't learned. If set to 0, a signal will be generated for all new values after the first value is learned.

query.Description: Queries for selecting logs which are part of the rule.

agent_rule.Deprecated: `agent_rule` has been deprecated in favor of new Agent Rule resource.

distinct_fields.Description: Field for which the cardinality is measured. Sent as an array.

metric.Description: The target field to aggregate over when using the sum or max aggregations.

name.Description: Name of the query.

type.Description: The rule type.

tags_filter.Description: A list of tags to limit the search

user_only_filter.Description: Limit the search to user rules

id.Description: A SLO ID to limit the search.

metrics_query.Description: Filter results based on SLO numerator and denominator.

name.Description: Name of the Datadog service level objective

name_query.Description: Filter results based on SLO names.

tags_query.Description: Filter results based on a single SLO tag.

type.Description: The type of the service level objective. The mapping from these types to the types found in the Datadog Web UI can be found in the Datadog API [documentation page](https://docs.datadoghq.com/api/v1/service-level-objectives/#create-a-slo-object). Available values are: `metric` and `monitor`.

ids.Description: An array of SLO IDs to limit the search.

metrics_query.Description: Filter results based on SLO numerator and denominator.

name_query.Description: Filter results based on SLO names.

id.Description: ID of the Datadog service level objective

name.Description: Name of the Datadog service level objective

type.Description: The type of the service level objective. The mapping from these types to the types found in the Datadog Web UI can be found in the Datadog API [documentation page](https://docs.datadoghq.com/api/v1/service-level-objectives/#create-a-slo-object). Available options to choose from are: `metric` and `monitor`.

tags_query.Description: Filter results based on a single SLO tag.

name.Description: The synthetics global variable name to search for. Must only match one global variable.

tags.Description: A list of tags assigned to the Synthetics global variable.

locations.Description: A map of available Synthetics location IDs to names for Synthetics tests.

filter.Description: Filter all users by the given string.

name.Description: Name of the user.
